name: Vegan Dal Makhani - Black lentils and Beans in creamy buttery gravy
description: How to make restaurant style non-dairy Dal Makhani. gluten-free Soy-free Indian Recipe. Instant Pot Option in notes
recipeIngredient: 1 cup whole black gram (, Urad Whole or use black lentils(see first paragraph for sub options))
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder ( or cayenne or to taste)
2-3  green chilis finely chopped (I use Serrano chili pepper)
1 Tablespoon dried fenugreek leaves (Kasoori methi, or Use a 1/2 teaspoon fenugreek/methi seeds-Optional)
1/3 cup Cashew milk (Blend 3 tbsp cashews in 1/3 cup water until smooth. )
Vegan butter such as Earth Balance as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Soak the lentils and beans overnight.
recipeInstructions.name: Soak the lentils and beans overnight.

recipeInstructions.text: Pressure cook black gram and Kidney beans in 3.5 cups of water with salt and chili powder for 3-4 whistles (25 minutes at high pressure once pressure has reached).
recipeInstructions.name: Pressure cook black gram and Kidney beans in 3.5 cups of water with salt and chili powder for 3-4 whistles (25 minutes at high pressure once pressure has reached).

recipeInstructions.text: Or use a slow cooker to cook urad beans and keep ready. Kidney beans cannot be cooked in a slow cooker from raw state, so use 1 cup cooked canned beans.
recipeInstructions.name: Or use a slow cooker to cook urad beans and keep ready. Kidney beans cannot be cooked in a slow cooker from raw state, so use 1 cup cooked canned beans.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pan, add oil and heat on medium-high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pan, add oil and heat on medium-high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add cumin seeds and cook till they start to change color.
recipeInstructions.name: Add cumin seeds and cook till they start to change color.

recipeInstructions.text: Add ginger, garlic and green chili and saute until golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Add ginger, garlic and green chili and saute until golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Add onion, asafetida and cook until translucent.
recipeInstructions.name: Add onion, asafetida and cook until translucent.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the tomato and turmeric and cook until tomatoes are mushy. (13-15 minutes till this step).
recipeInstructions.name: Add the tomato and turmeric and cook until tomatoes are mushy. (13-15 minutes till this step).

recipeInstructions.text: Add the cooked black gram, kidney beans and the water they were cooked in.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the cooked black gram, kidney beans and the water they were cooked in.

recipeInstructions.text: Add garam masala, fenugreek and the milks. Mix, taste and adjust salt.
recipeInstructions.name: Add garam masala, fenugreek and the milks. Mix, taste and adjust salt.

recipeInstructions.text: Add more water if the mixture is too thick.
recipeInstructions.name: Add more water if the mixture is too thick.

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer on low heat till the dals/beans are totally soft. Mash some of the lentils with the spatula. 30 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer on low heat till the dals/beans are totally soft. Mash some of the lentils with the spatula. 30 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Or Pressure cook for 5 minutes at high pressure once the pressure has reached. (1 whistle + simmer for 5)
recipeInstructions.name: Or Pressure cook for 5 minutes at high pressure once the pressure has reached. (1 whistle + simmer for 5)

recipeInstructions.text: Top with a small dollop of vegan butter or olive oil and cilantro.
recipeInstructions.name: Top with a small dollop of vegan butter or olive oil and cilantro.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with Roti/Naan flatbread or Rice Pilaf or other cooked grains like Quinoa, millet.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with Roti/Naan flatbread or Rice Pilaf or other cooked grains like Quinoa, millet.
